p: According to a 2013 Kenya National Bureau of Statistics (KNBS) economic survey, pneumonia, and tuberculosis were responsible for 13.7% of all total deaths in the Nyanza region [ 5]. It is important to note that illnesses of the upper respiratory tract are the second leading cause of death in Kisumu County [ 6]. Poor access to healthcare and scarcity of health resources in rural areas such as many parts of Kisumu East Sub County causes many inhabitants of such areas to rely on indigenous plant resources to manage common diseases including those that affect the respiratory system. Plant-based indigenous remedies may be key in the future management of respiratory system diseases [ 7]. However, the potential of this resource is largely untapped due to inadequate documentation by the herbalists who prepare the remedies.
